meanings.definition: A cylinder or block of wax or tallow with a central wick that is lit to produce light as it burns.
meanings.sent1: I lit a candle to brighten the room during the power outage.
meanings.sent2: She blew out the candle before going to bed.
meanings.sent3: The birthday cake had so many candles that it looked like a small bonfire.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a candle in the darkness, bringing warmth to everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The flickering candle cast dancing shadows on the wall, creating a cozy atmosphere.

meanings.definition: A unit of luminous intensity equal to the light given by a candle burning at a specified rate.
meanings.sent1: The room was well-lit with the brightness of a single candle.
meanings.sent2: The candlepower of the flashlight was impressive.
meanings.sent3: The competition for the brightest candle in the room was fierce.
meanings.sent4: His enthusiasm for the project was like a candle, lighting up the whole team.
meanings.sent5: The candle of hope burned brightly in their hearts, guiding them through tough times.
